camel.sink.path.configFile.name: camel.sink.path.configFile
camel.sink.path.configFile.description: Specifies the location to the solver file. If useSolverManager=FALSE, Camel uses this file and create the Solver. If useSolverManager=TRUE and SolverManager is set in the header {OptaPlannerConstants.SOLVER_MANAGER} : this file is ignored by Camel usage of SolverManager. SolverManager can be injected by DI in Quarkus or Spring.

camel.sink.endpoint.problemId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.problemId
camel.sink.endpoint.problemId.description: In case of using SolverManager : the problem id

camel.sink.endpoint.solverId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.solverId
camel.sink.endpoint.solverId.description: Specifies the solverId to user for the solver instance key

camel.sink.endpoint.useSolverManager.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useSolverManager
camel.sink.endpoint.useSolverManager.description: use SolverManager instead of XML file config. Use this mode on Quarkus app.

camel.sink.endpoint.async.name: camel.sink.endpoint.async
camel.sink.endpoint.async.description: Specifies to perform operations in async mode

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.threadPoolSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.threadPoolSize
camel.sink.endpoint.threadPoolSize.description: Specifies the thread pool size to use when async is true

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.optaplanner.lazyStartPro.name: camel.component.optaplanner.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.optaplanner.lazyStartPro.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.optaplanner.basicPropert.name: camel.component.optaplanner.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.optaplanner.basicPropert.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
